page.title: 12Changing Times in Farming
page.content: If you look at the farms in the Lanjeth area today, they are very different from a hundred years ago. Each farm would have employed 2 or 3 men, probably with their families living in the farm cottages. Many of the men would stay at the same farm for all of their working lives. The farm cottage was small, with no electricity or running water and would probably have a thatched roof. Most of the work in the fields was done with horses until the turn of the century when steam power was used. In 1985 the same amount of land is farmed with fewer men using large tractors and machinery. Many small farms have joined together to form large units with the farm house and cottages being sold off. Intensive systems can now produce more than enough food for our country. (H. May)
